experience: You and Joshua both know Fred Yu, Gelie Akhenblit, and 26 others
You both work in the same area
You and Joshua both currently work in Scottsdale, Arizona
Stuart Scott had an inspiring career in television before cancer took his life. This speech is one of the most famous in US history. He teaches the following:
- What it means to have a fighting spirit
- You can't do it by yourself
Just like Stuarts battle with cancer, you can't be successful in business alone. Stuart show's us that just like in life, it's how you do business and why you do business that matters.
Don't lose the battle. Remember what matters.
Best resume that I've ever seen.
Call me crazy but I'm a sucker for a straight shooter.

Make 60+ outbound calls a day to potential candidatesResponsible for applicant tracking/candidate sourcing (placing employment ads, attending job fairs, networking events)Utilize creative sourcing for hard-to-fill positionsIdentify and use unique sources for locating potential candidates, such as specific job boards (free and paid), LinkedIn networking groups and referralsDetailed resume analysis and screening of applicationsGenerate and distribute reports on recruiting activity and status reports as requested

Make 60+ outbound calls a day to potential candidatesResponsible for applicant tracking/candidate sourcing (placing employment ads, attending job fairs, networking events)Utilize creative sourcing for hard-to-fill positionsIdentify and use unique sources for locating potential candidates, such as specific job boards (free and paid), LinkedIn networking groups and referralsDetailed resume analysis and screening of applicationsGenerate and distribute reports on recruiting activity and status reports as requested

•Partners with hiring managers, senior leadership and Human Resources Business Partners to establish sourcing and recruiting strategies to create and foster strong active and passive candidate pipelines.•Develops an external network of vendors and talent sources that facilitates the development of a passive candidate pool, with focus on diversity and long term talent needs.•Provide periodic business metrics and reporting to communicate staffing efficiency and effectiveness to senior leadership.•Conducts actual recruiting for openings in all areas of the organization to include: Operations, IT, Finance and executive leadership roles.•Develops a sourcing strategy for these openings with the hiring manager, identifies candidates and presents a diverse candidate pool.•Understand market conditions for targeted sources and prepare distinct and effective recruiting approaches to those markets.•Develop an effective diversity recruiting plan.•Responsible for ensuring that the execution of the talent acquisition strategy follows legal and regulatory guidelines.•Partners with other HR team members on talent acquisition tasks, projects, and other HR priorities•Behavioral interviewing certification/experience a plus.•Demonstrated ability to define process gaps and make recommendations for improvement.•Pre-employment assessments experience a plus.•Demonstrated ability to influence, communicate and build relationships at all levels and to link business objectives with Talent Acquisition Strategy. •Must be extremely detail oriented.•Effective time management skills a must.•Ability to effectively multi-task.•Strong interpersonal skills and problem solving ability; capable and experienced user of data to drive decisions and influence stakeholders.•Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.•Demonstrated applicant tracking system (ATS) knowledge; MyStaffingPro preferred.

Primary Responsibilities:1.  Performs searches for qualified candidates according to relevant job criteria using computer databases, networking, Internet recruiting resources, cold calls, media, recruiting firms, employee referrals and job fairs. This includes contacting applicants to inform them of employment possibilities, consideration and selection. Incumbents may also relay information about the job, facilities, operations, benefits and related information. 2.  Reviews applications and resumes and performs routine reference checks and pre-employment activities. Forwards applicable resumes to hiring managers. May conduct reference and background checks on applicants. May also facilitate candidate drug screens and background investigations following Company standard operating procedures. 3.  Develops a flow of applicants for clerical, professional and managerial positions by placing advertisements in appropriate newspapers, online job boards, trade journals and other publications. Interacts with and manages relationships with search firms and employment agencies. Establishes relationships with hiring managers to stay abreast of current and future hiring and business needs. 4.  Interviews applicants for open clerical, professional and managerial level positions to obtain information on work history, training, education and preparation for job. 5.  Maintains applicant files, appropriate records and statistics. Generates and distributes reports on recruiting activity and status reports as requested. 6.  May provide support to hiring managers by scheduling and coordinating interviews, distributing interviewing schedules, and ensuring that all parties have the appropriate information. 7.  Maintains current knowledge of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and affirmative action guidelines and laws, such as the Americans with Disabilities Act by attending training, reading trade periodicals, etc

Primary Responsibilities:1. Initiates recruitment activities for TCH positions which may include applicant tracking, screening of applications, writes and reviews interview questions, mailings, internal and external ads, interviewing, reference checks, hiring recommendations, making job offers, and conducting New Employee Orientation (NEO) while ensuring compliance with all equal employment opportunity laws and TCH Affirmative Action Plan.2. Manages TCH advertising for open positions by creating and writing ads.  Represents TCH in advertising contracts with vendors.  Determines when and where to advertise in newspapers, on the internet and at various other locations, as appropriate.3. Attends job fairs and networking activities. Represents TCH at job opportunities in various community settings on an as-needed basis.  Continuously establishes effective recruiting sources, analyzes recruiting source effectiveness and makes recommendations.  4. Educates supervisors and managers on interviewing skills and ensures integrity of the recruitment and selection process.5. Continuously creates and maintains position requisitions within the Cyber Recruiter applicant database.  Tracks transfers, promotions and new hires within the applicant database.  Assists applicants and employees with the online application process as needed.6. Monitor and maintain I-9 recordkeeping and Social Security verifications through E-Verify in cooperation with the INS/DHS, which includes tracking, notification, follow up and distribution of expiring employment authorization documents.7. Collaborates with management to implement a recruitment/retention plan.  Initiates tracking and maintains data to determine the success of various projects relating to recruitment and retention ideas.8. Works with departments to ensure company-wide employment law compliance including Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, ADA, HIPPA, FLSA, FMLA and ADEA.

• Provide professional human resources services to state agencies, boards and commissions, human resources professionals, management and employees• Provided information regarding: federal and state employment laws, personnel rules, statewide HR policies, procedures relating to employment/staffing, classification and compensation, employee relations, discipline, training, grievances, reorganizations, reductions-in-force and agency policies.

Interview candidates and make recommendations for selection for State-wide Intern program for undergraduate and graduate level students.  Check references for executive-level positions such as agency and deputy directors.  Attend and participate in Human Resources training, Update portions of the Human Resources website and post updates on social media sites for the State. Post jobs on external websites for recruiting purposes.

recommendations: Julie Jones
Experienced & Skilled  Recruiter - Recruiting top talent to give our clients top results!
February 8, 2016, Julie was senior to Joshua but didn’t manage directly

When I worked with Joshua in the Travel Nursing Division, I watch him hit the ground running. Joshua took the time to learn the steps he needed to better himself as a recruiter. He became a strong and then moved into the Senior Recruiter role and in turn was able to help lead and develop other recruiters to thrive as well. I feel Joshua was successful at this role and will continue to be successful at anything he puts his mind too. I am excited to see where his future takes him.

I have the distinct pleasure to support Josh as he serves the State of Arizona as a Human Resources Intern.  Josh is extremely bright and enthusiastic with a focus on getting the job done and excellence in customer service!!  Josh is very talented when it comes to managing multiple priorities as he is pursuing his MBA, working at the UPS Store in addition to serving State Government.  I highly recommend Josh for a Human Resources position where his talents and winning personality can contribute to business objectives!!
